III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following: (c)
1

Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety, and
supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation When youth was previously placed at the facility, they would
sneak vape and dab pens. Youth reported that staff never found
them. Youth knew how to pass a drug screen by dipping it in
water. Youth reported that they were close to certain staff
members who would sometimes assist in sneaking in the vape
pens for youth.
Investigation On 11/28/2023 contact was made with the complainant. No
additional concerns were noted.
On 11/30/2023 an interview was held with Youth A via Phone.
DHHS Specialist 1 was present at the home of Youth A. Youth A
advised that he was recently released from Kent County Juvenile
Probation Facility this week and he was previously placed at
Highfields Residential Facility from 02/03/2022 to 07/30/2022. He
reported only liking “some of the staff” at Highfields and not liking
anything else regarding his placement at the facility. Youth A
gave a list of staff that he “liked”, notably Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 5
and Staff 6. He reported liking these staff because they were
understanding and easy to talk to. Youth A admitted to getting
caught with a vape while placed at the facility. He further reported
that other kids would sneak them in when returning from home
visits. Youth A could not recall the name of the staff that
confiscated the vape from him and denied knowing the specific
names of youth that would have the vapes. Youth A reported he
felt some of the staff may have known about the vapes, but they
did not pursue investigating anything further. Youth A reported
Staff 7 was “known” to follow policies but then stated Staff 7 was
perceived to “let things slide”. Youth A did not elaborate on the
type of things that Staff 7 would let slide. Youth A specifically
denied that he was provided or allowed to have a vape by staff.
He also denied ever being provided a “dab” or THC vape by staff.
He stated that staff would immediately report and take any vapes
found on youth. Youth A further advised that he did not like
“restraints” at Highfields. He reported he witnessed an incident
when a youth was placed in a “full nelson” by Staff 3 and Staff 4 in
May 2022. The full nelson move involves a staff placing his hands
under the arms of the youth and then locking them behind the
head and neck of the youth, making it difficult to move. He also
reported around February 2022 an unknown youth was dropped
on the cement by a staff and ended up in a restraint. This was
investigated under SI2022C0214014. Lastly Youth A reported in
2

July 2022 he saw a youth dragged and thrown around by Staff 4.
Youth A was unable to identify the youth that was involved in the
incidents listed above, but stated it could have been Youth D.
This is being investigated under 2024C0001094SI.
On 12/07/2023 an interview was held with Chief Administrator
(CA) at Highfields. DHHS Specialist 2 was also present. He was
advised of the allegations. He confirmed that Youth A was placed
at the facility from 02/2022 to 07/2022 and the agency requested
removal of Youth A from the program due to his behavior. He
recalled one time a room search was completed and a vape pen
was found in the room of Youth A. He confirmed that they
currently do not have any youth remaining at the facility that were
there when Youth A was placed there. CA further confirmed that
Staff 1 and Staff 3 still worked at the facility. CA provided
available contact information so that the staff that are no longer
employed with the agency could be contacted.
On 12/07/2023 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
B and Youth C at Highfields. DHHS Specialist 2 was also present.
Both youth denied having seen vape pens at the facility and stated
that there was no staff that would allow them to bring in vape
pens. They stated that youth caught with vapes or other
contraband would likely loose privileges or get a “phase freeze”
regarding their progress. The youth also indicated that staff are
appropriate and denied ever being involved in or witnessing any
inappropriate restraints. Youth C specifically stated that staff do
not let things slide and will hold youth accountable for their
actions.
On 12/07/2023 an in-person interview was completed with Staff 1
at Highfields. DHHS Specialist 2 was also present. He confirmed
that he is currently working as a paraprofessional with the school
district, but also picks up shifts with Highfields due to staff
shortages and works as a supervisor for Highfields on the
weekend. Staff 1 described Youth A as volatile, non-compliant,
aggressive and angry. He reported that the youth demonstrated
anger with everyone, but recalled that he had a “decent”
relationship with Youth A. He noted that there was one staff that
he seemed to have a particularly close relationship with and
identified her as Staff 2. He denied ever seeing anything
inappropriate between the two and denied ever hearing any
rumors about staff sneaking in contraband. He confirmed that
when Youth A was placed in the facility, there was a problem with
vapes. He stated he would not call it an epidemic, but noted staff
were concerned. Staff 1 denied knowledge of inappropriate
3

restraints and stated that staff try to maintain a hands-off
approach unless youth are trying to hurt themselves or someone
else. He could not recall if Youth D was restrained and indicated
that he was the assigned personal advocate for Youth D, so he
knew him well.
On 12/14/2023 DHHS Specialist 2 and I attempted to contact
former Highfields staff via telephone. Attempts to Staff 2 were
unsuccessful. A voicemail message was left. Telephone call to
Staff 7 was also unsuccessful. A voicemail message and text
message were sent requesting a return call. A response was
received indicating it was the wrong number.
On 12/14/2023 a phone interview was completed with Staff 3.
DHHS specialist 2 was also present. Staff 3 confirmed that she
remembered Youth A and recalled that he had both good and bad
days. She further recalled that it was “insinuated” that Youth A
was bringing drugs onto Highfields campus. Staff 3 confirmed that
there was an issue with Vape pens and she had found some on
the campus. She could not, however, confirm if Youth A was ever
found with any. She denied any knowledge of allegations that staff
at the facility were supplying the vapes or allowing youth to bring
in vapes. Staff 3 also denied that there were rumors regarding
Staff 2 providing vapes. Staff 3 reported that she recalled Youth A
was more respectful toward Staff 2 than he was with other staff.
She denied that there were any concerns with the engagement
and relationship between Staff 2 and Youth A. Staff 3 confirmed
that she also recalled Youth D. She did not recall being involved in
any restraints with the youth and denied knowledge of staff being
involved in inappropriate restraints with youth at Highfields.
On 12/14/2023 a telephone interview was completed with Staff 4.
DHHS Specialist 2 was also present. Staff 4 confirmed that he
remembered Youth A. He also recalled there were rumors about
issues with Vape pens on the campus and staff bringing them in.
He reported that he believed the most likely way they came onto
the campus was via the youth when they returned from home
passes. He reported that there was no proof or evidence of staff
being involved. Staff 4 reported that he recalled Youth A and Staff
2 were close. He stated he thought that Youth A may have had
feelings for Staff 2. He stated he never saw anything inappropriate
but recalled that he would request Staff 2 when he was in trouble
and had a difficult time when Staff 2 ended her employment with
the agency. He denied that there were any rumors of anything
inappropriate occurring between Staff 2 and Youth A. Staff 4
4

denied remembering any inappropriate restraints taking place at
the agency, including any involving Youth D.
On 12/20/2023 a DHHS closing meeting was held via video.
DHHS Specialist 2 advised that her investigation resulted in no
findings relative to abuse or neglect.
On 12/21/2023 a meeting was held with CA. The DHHS
Specialist was also present, and the meeting took place via video.
CA was advised of DHHS Specialist findings, and I informed him
that DCWL would provide final disposition of case once report is
finalized.
Documents reviewed:
Face sheets of Youth B and Youth C
MiSACWIS Incident Reports for Highfields submitted between
February 2022 and May 2022 – there were no IR’s that
supported documentation of inappropriate restraints involving staff
and Youth D.
Highfields Staff Expectation Policy – documented that
Highfields staff is expected to provide safety and ongoing
supervision of all youth.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, there was no evidence to
support violation of licensing rule 4109-1C relative to improper
supervision by Highfields staff. Youth A specifically denied that he
was ever provided a vape or was allowed to vape by staff.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
